title: BBC Local Live: Coventry & Warwickshire on Friday 18 August 2017 - BBC News
summary: barcelona attack a 'huge shock ' says holidaymaker .
indian restaurant fined after 'food safety breaches ' .

text: coventry city 0-1 newport county

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: live updates for herefordshire and worcestershire have finished for the day but we 'll be back from 08:00 on monday with more live news , sport , travel and weather .

documents.title: warwickshire council flying flag at half for spanish terror victims
text: warwick district council has taken to twitter to announce it 's flying its flag at half-mast in tribute to those in spain who were caught up in two terror attacks carried out in quick succession .
thirteen people were killed and dozens injured after a van drove into pedestrians in barcelona .
one person has died and six others wounded when a car was driven into them in cambrils just hours later .
the union flag is flying at half-mast at the town hall following the events in barcelona yesterday .

documents.title: weather : showers tomorrow and more on sunday
text: we 'll have a few showers tomorrow and more on sunday , but the weather is expected to improve next week .
author: Rebecca Wood
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: coventry city fans blast `` disgraceful '' treatment of ricoh arena wall of fame bricks
text: coventry city fans have branded the treatment of walls at the ricoh arena , which contain bricks bearing the names of supporters , as disgraceful '' .
author: Coventry Telegraph

documents.title: football : sky blues defender 'ca n't complain ' ahead of league clash
text: coventry city 's rod mcdonald says he `` ca n't complain ' about the squad 's league two success so far this season .
the 25-year-old , who was one of twelve new additions to the team this summer , has been speaking ahead of the sky blues ' game against newport county at the ricoh tomorrow afternoon .
city sit at the summit of the league table following two straight victories .
you pride yourself on a cleansheet and the lads in the forward areas are scoring goals , so i ca n't complain . ''

documents.title: expert says a fridge is the key to cutting out car theft
text: a coventry-based security expert claims car theft can be prevented by storing the vehicle 's keys in a fridge to block hacking technology .
madeline cheah , from coventry university , has been responding to news that an experienced car thief can steal a high performance car in six seconds using digital equipment .
a man from solihull had his land rover taken from his driveway on monday .
author: Sarah Bishop
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: tips for a special parkrun weekend
text: it 's a special weekend in parks around the country .
this saturday , 19 august , those who take part in their local parkrun might find themselves jogging alongside some of the country 's sporting stars .
it 's all part of campaign for national lottery-funded athletes to give back and say thank you .
and , if you 've never heard of of done a parkrun , it 's really easy to get involved .
here 's team gb rowing legend katherine grainger to give you the low down in five simple steps # getinspired

documents.title: cathedral appoints artist-in-residence ' for 2018
text: coventry cathedral has announced it 's chosen its artist-in-residence for 2018 .
james webb , a renowned visual artist based in cape town , will be working on pieces commissioned as part of the diocese of coventry 's celebration of its centenary .
the artist is renowned for his use of audio and text as part of his work .
from its important cultural history to its work with peace and reconciliation , to have coventry cathedral and its context to work with is a rich and challenging prospect . ''

documents.title: scam victims to be compensated
text: people who fell victim to a multi-million pound advertising scam , masterminded by a warwickshire businessman , are to be awarded compensation .
jonathan rivers , 55 , from coleshill was jailed in october last year for heading up wyvern media group , based in derby , which pressured firms into buying worthless advertising space .
nine directors have now been ordered to pay more than £ 160,000 in compensation to their 45 victims as part of £ 1.6m confiscated under the proceeds of crime act .
the remaining money will be paid to the government , the courts and trading standards for further criminal investigations .

documents.title: restaurant waiter 'blew on poppadoms '
text: restaurant waiter 'blew on poppadoms '

documents.title: coventry headteacher died after suffering massive allergic reaction to antibiotics
text: a coventry headteacher died after suffering a massive allergic reaction to antibiotics prescribed by his gp , an inquest heard .
author: Coventry Telegraph

documents.title: your questions on london midland losing its rail franchise answered
text: rail services in the west midlands are to be run by a new operator from december - but what does this mean for passengers ?
west midlands trains ltd says it will put £ 1bn into improving the routes it takes over from london midland .
the plans include 400 new carriages , free wifi and space for an extra 85,000 passengers on rush-hour services in birmingham and london .
news website readers sent in questions about the takeover and you can read some of the answers here .
author: BBC News England

documents.title: actress speaks out about husbands death
text: coventry actress holly matthews has spoken to bbc coventry & warwickshire for the first time since the death of her husband .
ross blair - who 's the son of former sky blues player andy blair - died almost three weeks ago from a brain tumour .
his family have been raising money for charities like myton hos where ross was looked after during his illness .
the thing that gives me massive strength in everything is knowing that ross himself was ok with everything he was very positive about life .
author: Trish Adudu
BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: help create coventry 's 2tone taxi
text: coventry & warwickshire needs your help to decorate a taxi to celebrate the city and the people in it .
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: kes scoops best a-level results in county
text: the best a-level results in the county went to king edward vi school .
author: Stratford Observer

documents.title: leamington 'could ' host bowls in 2022 commonwealth games
text: victoria park in leamington has been revealed as the lawn bowls and para lawn bowls venue for birmingham 's 2022 commonwealth games bid .
the venue , which stages the annual national bowls championship , can hold over 3000 spectators .
hosting the commonwealth games bowls fixtures at the home of lawn bowls in england would be an incredible experience . ''

documents.title: council flag flying at half for spanish terror victims
text: coventry city council has posted a of a spanish flag flying at half-mast in tribute to those caught up in two terror attacks carried out within hours of each other .
thirteen people were killed and dozens injured after a van drove into pedestrians in barcelona .
one person has died and six others wounded when a car was driven into them in cambrils just hours later .
we 're flying the spanish flag at half-mast today to express our deepest condolences to the people of # barcelona .

documents.title: campaigners urge for rethink on proposed cuts to warwickshire children 's centres
text: campaigners are urging councillors to rethink their proposed cuts to children 's centres after handing over a 1,800-signature petition to warwickshire county council .
author: Leamington Courier

documents.title: football : sky blues boss expecting 'tough ' game
text: coventry city manager , mark robins , says he 's expecting a difficult game against newport county on saturday .
the sky blues currently sit at the top of the league two table but the exiles visit the ricoh arena on a two-game unbeaten run .
i 'm expecting a really tough game , very similar to what we 've faced so far .
firstly there will be a physical threat , but they 've also got some decent players who will want to come and perform well at the ricoh .

documents.title: indian restaurant fined for food safety breaches
text: an indian restaurant in rugby has been served a £ 7,300 legal bill after pleading guilty to a string of food safety offences .
the masala lounge was prosecuted by rugby borough council after a routine inspection uncovered a number of hygiene breaches .

environmental health officers visited the restaurant in march and found chest freezers with mouldy door seals , a dirty fridge and a waiter blowing on a plate of poppadoms which he said were `` too hot '' to serve to a customer .

documents.title: rail delays between birmingham and coventry
text: london midland is warning rail passengers to expect delays on services running between tile hill and birmingham new street due to trespassers on the line .
due to trespassers on the railway between tile hill and birmingham new street , services running through these stations may be delayed
run them down

documents.title: fire service pays tribute to spain terror victims
text: west midlands fire has taken to twitter to express their sympathy for the people of spain in two terror attacks carried out in quick succession .
thirteen people were killed and dozens injured after a van drove into pedestrians in barcelona .
police later shot dead five suspected terrorists in the town of cambrils following a second vehicle attack .
our thoughts are with those affected by the terrible events recently in spain # barcelonaattack # spain # solidarity

documents.title: your questions on new rail franchise
text: your questions on new rail franchise

documents.title: disabled coventry man says he is victim of hate crime - because his wheelie-bin is left unemptied
text: a disabled coventry man claims he is the victim of hate crime - because bin men regularly fail to empty his wheelie-bins .
author: Coventry Telegraph

documents.title: holidaymakers 'defiant ' over spain terror attacks
text: people preparing to holiday in spain have told bbc coventry & warwickshire they wo n't change their plans despite two terror attacks within hours of each other .
thirteen people were killed and dozens injured after a van drove into pedestrians in barcelona .
police later shot dead five suspected terrorists in the town of cambrils following a second vehicle attack .
i was planning on going to barcelona but could n't get the flights so i 'm off to madrid in 10 days .
i will still go because you ca n't let them win . ''
author: Vic Minett
BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: rugby : wasps secure first pre-season win
text: wasps rugby club started their pre-season preparations with a win over ulster in belfast .
the side scored four tries in the 26-15 victory .
they return to the ricoh next wednesday to face connacht .

documents.title: officers express 'appreciation ' for thank you card
text: police in warwickshire have taken to twitter to express their gratitude for a hand-made thank you card sent to the force for their assistance following a road traffic collision .
we 'd like to say thank you for the lovely card from a member of the public we assisted that had been involved in a rtc recently.cm
are they pentagrams i think that 's a hidden good luck spell she 's sent you .

documents.title: barcelona attack was a 'huge shock '
text: a coventry woman , who 's on holiday in barcelona , says last night 's attack in the city was a `` huge shock '' .
thirteen people were killed and dozens injured after a van drove into pedestrians in barcelona before a second vehicle attack in the nearby town of cambrils .
janet powell says she had walked along the same route the van took the day before .
it was a huge shock to see this hitting the news yesterday because it 's such an amazing , buzzing , busy part of barcelona absolutely rammed with tourists whatever the time of day . ''

documents.title: football : sky blues prepare for 'historic ' game
text: a little bit of history will be made at the ricoh arena on saturday when coventry city face newport county in league two .
it 'll be the first time the sky blues have played the welsh side since they reformed in 1989 .
coventry top the league table with six points , going into the game .
author: Clive Eakin
BBC Coventry & Warwickshire Sport

documents.title: warwickshire mp hails response to spain terror attacks
text: the mp for stratford-upon-avon , nadhim zahawi , has praised the people of spain for their response to two terror attacks within hours of each other .
thirteen people were killed and dozens injured after a van drove into pedestrians in barcelona .
police later shot dead five suspected terrorists in the town of cambrils following a second vehicle attack .
most effective response from the great people of barcelona & spain is to get back to business and reopen their shops and streets .
well done !
no ppl need to know from gov that all followrs of proto terrorist warlord famed for massive harem of sex slaves will be closely scrutinized !

documents.title: missing girl found , police confirm
text: a missing teenager from beoley in redditch , who has links to coventry , has been found , police say .
cindy worthington had been reported missing on monday evening .
missing girl from redditch found thanks for all your help .
kevin
that 's great news
it is .
was real worry .
safe & well ?

documents.title: cricket : england dominate at uk 's first day-night test held at edgbaston
text: alastair cook and joe root hit centuries as england dominated west indies on the first day of the inaugural day-night test in the uk .
cook batted through the day for his unbeaten 153 , sharing 248 with skipper root , who made 136 , as england racked up 348-3 at edgbaston .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: air museum celebrates half a century
text: air museum celebrates half a century

text: friday 's started with sunshine for much of the west midlands and here 's how the rest of the day and the start of this weekend is looking .

text: dead tourist caught in rip current named

documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 tomorrow , but keep an eye out here for more updates this evening and into the morning .

documents.title: watch : air museum celebrates half a century
text: the midland air museum is celebrating its 50th year with a summer exhibition .
the event at the attraction near baginton , warwickshire , is on for three weeks and features original artwork along with aircraft displays .
when the museum first opened to the public it attracted 67 visitors .
it now has more than 30,000 a year .
author: BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: farmers market back on the streets
text: the market will be on coventry 's broadgate from 09:00 until 15:00 .
the farmer 's market returns to broadgate this friday 18 august .
open from 9-3pm come and browse a great selection of fresh , local produce
venison for tea tomorrow

documents.title: weather : some showers on the way tomorrow
text: we 're forecast a dry and mild night , but there could be a few showers tomorrow .
author: Shefali Oza
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: your grey lakes and blue skies
text: here 's a couple of lovely taken by our bbc weather watchers .
this first one was taken in bodymoor heath by ruthieroo .
old salt sent in this taken in southam .
share your weather here .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: portacabin fire in snitterfield
text: warwickshire fire and rescue service have released these of a cabin fire yesterday .
the service say they were called to babe ke farm in snitterfield .
a portacabin and surrouding trees were on fire .

documents.title: police `` extremely concerned '' over missing teenager
text: a teenager missing from beoley in redditch , who officers are `` extremely concerned '' about , has links to coventry , warwickshire police say .
cindy worthington was reported missing on monday evening .
we 're extremely concerned for cindy 's welfare and would urge anyone who has seen her or knows of her whereabouts to contact us as a matter of urgency . ''

documents.title: day-night test : 'woakes was n't quite ready '
text: warwickshire all-rounder , chris woakes , has been left out of the england side taking on the west indies in the inaugural day-night test at edgbaston .
england captain , joe root , said : '' it 's difficult when you have such depth in your bowling , we felt chris woakes was n't quite ready .
`` he will have another week to get ready and make sure there 's not another injury around the corner . ''
`` it 's new and exciting , a great opportunity to start off the series strong .
mark stoneman is a fine player , he 's had a fantastic season and i hope he steps up and takes his chance . ''

documents.title: mulberries in shakespeare 's gardens harvested for local gin
text: fruit from historic mulberry trees in the garden of shakespeare 's new place has been harvested to produce a very special stratford tipple .
author: Stratford Observer

documents.title: breakingman drowned at crantock named as oneil din
text: a man who died when out swimming off the north cornwall coast has been named as oneil din , a 27-year-old from coventry .

numerous friends have paid tribute to mr din online , including from the church , the great commission ministry , which said mr din was a member and said : `` we thank you for your smiles and laughter . ''
an inquest into the death of mr din was opened and adjourned at truro city hall this afternoon .

documents.title: day-night test : when the players get a break
text: here 's how today should , in theory , go down :
play can go on until 22:00 but the most likely close of play is 21:30 .

documents.title: man faces trial over historical sex offences
text: a man will face trial charged with historical sex offences against three children .
the 56-year-old , from rugby , is due to appear at warwick crown court next month charged with raping a girl aged between 13 and 15 .
he is also charged with two counts of indecent assault on a girl under 16 and gross indecency with a girl under 16 .
the alleged crimes , in the 1990s and 2000s , also include taking an indecent photograph of a child and possession of an indecent photo .
the man appeared before magistrates yesterday and was granted bail .
author: Monica Rimmer
Journalist, BBC Online

documents.title: cyclists saddle up for shakespeare hos
text: more than 600 cyclists saddled up for the great shakespeare ride , raising £ 20,000 for the shakespeare hos
author: Stratford Observer

documents.title: cricket : inaugural day-night test in england
text: there 's not long to go until the first day-night test in england gets underway at warwickshire county cricket club 's ground .
england have won the toss , and will bat first .
edgbaston is hosting the test against the west indies .

documents.title: warwickshire restaurant makes good food guide
text: a warwickshire restaurant has been included in the latest good food guide .
salt in stratford has been named as the best new entry .
head chef , paul foster , says they were blown away when they found out about the award .
thank you all for your kind words we are a little speechless above everything thank you so much to our amazing team .
will have to pop in again soon to celebrate !
huge congrats @ twitterid and all at @ twitterid get yourselves to salt , stratfordians !
x
thanks a lot sinead , look forward to having you back soon .
wonderful news !
congratulations @ twitterid
amazing achievement in a short time .
best of british for the future !
oh and see you sept 2nd for dinner !
# happychappies
you guys back from holiday .
dying to visit
congratulations !
author: Alec Blackman
BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: new rail service will now stop at three staffordshire stations
text: train passengers in staffordshire who looked set to lose a rail route to london are being told now there will be a direct service .
last week it was revealed west midlands trains ltd was taking over the routes currently operated by london midland from december .
at the time , the department for transport said passengers from stoke-on-trent would in future have to change at stafford .
today , west midlands trains says it has finalised details of its routes and there will be a direct service from december 2018 .
the operator says it will call at stone , kidsgrove and stoke-on-trent and then go via birmingham via coventry on the way to euston without people having to change trains .
author: Allen Cook
BBC Local Live

documents.title: woman fails to appear in court in connection with tragic death of nuneaton rugby player
text: the woman who was involved in the tragic collision which claimed the life of a popular nuneaton rugby player has failed to attend a hearing at the magistrates ' court in leamington .
author: Nuneaton News

documents.title: dukes pink ball : what the players think of the latest innovation
text: england take on the west indies at edgbaston today in the first day-night test in england .
the teams will be wearing traditional white clothing but using a pink dukes ball .
but that ball has split opinion .
after practicing under the edgbaston lights on monday , england all-rounder moeen ali acknowledged that the pink ball is `` different '' .
he added : `` it feels lighter off the bat .
sometimes you do n't feel like you 've hit it and it goes ; other times you 've nailed it and it does n't .
but you get used to it .
i did by the end of the session . ''
warwickshire coach ashley giles said that on day one of the day-night match against lancashire in june there were `` a couple of incidents where guys were not sure where the ball had gone '' .
however , durham all-rounder paul collingwood , was less positive after making 25 off the pink ball in a rain-affected draw against worcestershire in june .
he described it as `` shocking '' and `` like plastic when you hit it '' .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: traffic pile-up at a46 jlr turn-off after crash
text: a crash involving two vehicles is causing major tailbacks on the a46 this morning .
author: Coventry Telegraph

documents.title: affordable housing plans approved
text: plans to turn the old dairy crest site in leamington into affordable housing have been approved by councillors .
warwick district councillors backed the proposals - 18 new homes will be sold at cost or below the market value .
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: breakingcrantock rip current victim from coventry
text: a man who died after being caught in a rip current off the coast of cornwall was from coventry , police say .
the 27-year-old holidaymaker died , and two others were taken to hospital , after being swept out to sea off crantock beach , near newquay , just before 19:30 on tuesday .
they were rescued by two local surfers and airlifted to the royal cornwall hospital .
the man died shortly after arriving .

documents.title: hydrochloric acid leak in warehouse
text: diluted hydrochloric acid has leaked from a chemical container in dordon , warwickshire .
warwickshire fire and rescue service say they were called to a warehouse on jim casey way at 00:12 this morning to reports of a leaking and smoking container .
the warehouse had been evacuated - no-one was injured and the chemical was `` contained '' .

documents.title: the controversial pink cricket ball : how is it made ?
text: the dukes pink cricket ball will be used for the first time in the day-night test match at edgbaston later today , when england play the west indies .
dilip jadojia , the owner of dukes , is confident the pink ball will be a success .
author: BBC World Service

documents.title: new gps want to work as locums , study shows
text: a new study by the university of warwick has found only two in every three doctors who are completing their training to become gps want to work in nhs general practice .
of those intending to remain in the nhs , most plan to work as locums or salaried gps , rather than entering a gp partnership .
the study found the quality of general practice experience during training and concerns about workload pressure and morale were among the reasons for their decision .
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: a-level results day
text: thousands of students across coventry and warwickshire are getting their a-level results this morning .
those who do n't get the grades they want can go through clearing to get a place at university .
coventry university and the university of warwick both have advice for students and details on how to get in touch with their clearing service .
once again , good luck to everyone receiving # alevelresults !
if you wan na see what courses we can offer you visit
it 's # resultsday !
best of luck with your results today .
our # clearing & # adjustment hotline will open at 8am - just 30 minutes to wait

documents.title: watch : today 's weather in 54 seconds
text: it 's been a wet start for many of us in the west midlands - here 's how the rest of thursday is looking .
you can also find the latest forecasts at any other time on the bbc weather website .
author: Alex Hamilton
BBC Weather

documents.title: live updates for coventry and warwickshire
text: good morning , we 'll be bringing you the latest news , sport , travel and weather updates for coventry and warwickshire between now and 18:00 .
if you 'd like to get in touch , you can reach us on facebook or tweet @ twitterid
author: Monica Rimmer
Journalist, BBC Online

documents.title: our coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 on thursday .
keep an eye out here for more updates and breaking news before then .

documents.title: coming up on bbc midlands today : english cricket history
text: cricket history will be made at edgbaston tomorrow when the first day-night test match played in england gets under way .
west indies are the opposition under the lights and 70,000 tickets have already been sold .
joe root 's side is the odds-on favourite to win the three-match series .
the west indies have a good record at edgbaston , they 've won four of the last five test matches at warwickshire 's home .
our reporter will have more on bbc one from 18:30 .
author: BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: how can delays at airport be eased ?
text: a newly formed taskforce will meet later today after a summer of complaints by people waiting for baggage at birmingham airport .
local councils , businesses and travel agents will meet airport bosses to discuss improvements .
some passengers have been warned to turn up to the airport at least three hours before their flights are due to leave .
birmingham airport confirms that ground handler , swissport , is at times experiencing staffing issues which are intermittently affecting the operation .
it has employed more than 250 additional staff for the summer peak season .
some passengers tell us they are having to wait hours for luggage and have been stuck on planes waiting for stairs and buses to take them to the terminal .
author: James Bovill
Reporter, BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: new principal of coventry college looking forward to challenge
text: the new principal of coventry college has told bbc coventry and warwickshire he 's looking forward to the challenge of improving the newly-created institution .
it 's been formed through a merger of city and henley colleges and starts teaching students at the beginning of the new academic year .
peter brammall said it was an opportunity he did n't want to miss .

the opportunity to bring two organisations together is quite a rare one , and particularly at a time when coventry has got so many opportunities that will require skills , i just felt it was too good a chance to miss . ''
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: unemployment up in the west midlands
text: unemployment went up by 5.8 % across the west midlands in the three months to june , according to data .
figures from the ons show 164,000 people are registered as out of work across the region - an increase of 3,000 people compared with the first three months of the year .
author: Monica Rimmer
Journalist, BBC Online

documents.title: watch : your 50-second weather forecast
text: skies will cloud over this evening as rain erratically moves east with brisk winds .
rain will continue overnight , with some heavy bursts at times .
however , rain will start to clear towards dawn .
lows of 15c ( 59f ) .
author: Shefali Oza
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: crimestoppers grant
text: the charity crimestoppers has been granted £ 16,000 by warwickshire 's police and crime commissioner to encourage more people to report information about offences .
the funding , from philip seccombe 's commissioner 's grants scheme , will enable the charity to run targeted campaigns .
the funding includes recruiting a youth worker to deliver the charity 's `` fearless '' initiative to schools and youth groups across the county .
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: staff brave three peaks challenge to help baby unit
text: braving the three peaks challenge has led to a £ 3,000 donation for warwick hospital 's special care baby unit .
author: Leamington Observer

documents.title: jogger suffers arm injury in hit-and-run
text: a jogger was hurt in a hit-and-run crash this morning , police say .
the man , 30 , suffered an injury to his arm when a lorry hit him .
it happened at about 10:30 on leicester road between shilton and wolvey .
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: armed robbery at ladbrokes
text: a robber armed with a gun targeted a branch of bookmaker ladbrokes where an employee was hit over the head .
west midlands police said a man carrying a handgun tried to get into the premises while a staff member was opening up this morning .
the 25-year-old employee was hit - but not seriously injured - and the offender made off with a mobile phone .
police were called to the shop on robin hood road in willenhall , coventy , just after 09:00 .

documents.title: can airport cope with passenger increase ?
text: people travelling through birmingham airport could face long delays as staff struggle to cope with the growing number of passengers during the summer holiday period .
the airport is expecting more than two million passengers over the six-week school holiday period - an 11 % rise compared to last year .
steve mccarthy from great barr ( says he and his family waited for more than three hours to collect their luggage last month , as well as delays getting off the flight .
author: Nicola Beckford
Reporter, BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: your
text: this lovely closeup flower shot was taken in coleshill by rons view .
we 're missing that blue sky today .
stratford-upon-avon is the setting for this great shot sent in by scotslass45 .
share your weather here .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: rugby : wasps team news for friendly
text: dai young has named his squad for the wasps ' first pre-season fixture against ulster on thursday .
he told the wasps ' website : `` we 're all looking forward to our first hit out on thursday night .
`` we know that ulster will provide a very stern challenge for us and the game is set to be a real test , against a very good side . ''
team news : dai young names a 26-man squad to face @ twitterid at @ twitterid tomorrow night , ko 7.30pm
great stuff # coyw ! !

documents.title: cricket : woakes needs more recovery time says root
text: england test captain joe root says warwickshire all-rounder chris woakes will feel unfortunate to have missed out playing at his home ground in the day-night test - the first to be held in the country .

the 28-year-old has been left out of the side to face the west indies at edgbaston on thursday and root says it 's because woakes needs more recovery time , having only just come back from a side strain .

[ woakes ] will have definitely wanted to play here but with the lack of game time he 's had , it felt like another week of loading up on overs , making sure he 's absolutely ready coming back from a serious injury , is important . ''

documents.title: simba wins scarecrow prize at brailes show
text: simba stole the show as the best scarecrow at brailes show .
author: Stratford Observer

documents.title: breakingcricket : warwickshire 's woakes left out of day-night test
text: warwickshire all-rounder chris woakes has been left out of the first pink-ball , day-night test in this country .
england take on the west indies at woakes ' home ground edgbaston tomorrow .

documents.title: your comments on father and daughter triathlon duo
text: we shared with you earlier the story of the father and daughter duo who take part in triathlons .
chloe , who 's 11 , has cerebral palsy and is visually impaired .
she and her father stephan are taking on the super hero triathlon this weekend .
on the bbc midlands facebook page , many of you have said what an inspiration the pair are .
what an amazing family , well done and keep up the good work ''
brilliant you are an inspiration .
good luck . ''
inspirational duo !
what an amazing family !
good luck . ''
author: Monica Rimmer
Journalist, BBC Online

documents.title: wcc boss says edgbaston plan is to make it world 's 'best cricket business '
text: the boss of warwickshire county cricket club and edgbaston stadium says the £ 85m plan to build homes and retail venues among other new provision at the site is part of a 20-year masterplan that started in 2010 .
neil snowball said : `` the vision of warwickshire ccc is to be the very best cricket business in the world . ''
the proposals are designed , he said , to `` further enhance our match day experience for our members , our supporters and for cricket fans '' .

documents.title: new homes in £ 85m edgbaston development
text: warwickshire county cricket club has announced an £ 85m project to build 375 build-to-rent homes as well as retail venues at edgbaston .
the proposed development is for a four-acre area of the site .
it will , wcc says , also provide a new main entrance to the stadium on edgbaston road , a plaza area for match days and a extension to car parking behind the res wyatt stand .

documents.title: owls at market event hope to turn heads
text: owls from a local sanctuary will be on display when the farmers market returns to broadgate in coventry city centre on friday .
stalls will be open between 09:00 and 15:00 , with traders offering locally-sourced produce .

documents.title: cricket : woakes delivers verdict on collingwood 's pink ball spin
text: chris woakes says it feels quite nice bowling with the pink ball that 's being used in the historical day-night test match between england and the west indies at edgbaston on thursday .
woakes , who is hoping to play on his home ground after recovering from a side strain , also says it 'll be exciting to see what happens with the ball .
his comments come after the former england all-rounder paul collingwood criticised the ball , telling the bbc it does all sorts in the first ten overs , and then becomes as soft as plastic .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: your sunny skies
text: this lovely was taken in hillmorton by bbc weather watcher paulamaria .
southam is the setting for this beautiful blue-sky shot taken by old salt .
share your weather with us here .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: bungling nuneaton robber admits bank raid
text: a robber who had threatened to blow a nuneaton bank cashier 's brains out if he did not hand over money did not hold on to the cash himself for very long .
author: Nuneaton News

documents.title: english cricket steps into the dark at bears ' home
text: english cricket takes a step into the dark on thursday with the first day-night test played in the country when joe root 's side faces west indies .
the opening game of a three-match series is at edgbaston and will be only the fifth test anywhere to be played under the day-night format .
here 's what warwickshire chief executive neil snowball told bbc sport :
`` it was first mooted by [ ecb director of cricket ] andrew strauss who was looking ahead to the ashes this winter .
`` we were cautious to start with - i 'll be honest - because we 've done 49 tests and we sell test cricket very well .
`` but then the more we looked at , we thought 'well , actually , we are innovative , it will be a first and it should be good for edgbaston ' .
`` strauss and i sat in here at edgbaston having a cup of tea watching the cricket last summer and decided , 'should we go for it or not ? '
we said 'yes , let 's do it ' .
i 'm delighted that we have . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: mother of boy hurt in park attack 'overwhelmed by support '
text: three teenagers arrested over an assault on a boy in a nuneaton park have been released under investigation , say police who have made a fresh appeal for witnesses - particularly residents neighbouring the site .
the boy , 13 , was left with serious facial injuries and had his phone , watch and wallet stolen during the attack at george eliot memorial park on thursday , 3 august .
it happened at about 19:20 .
a fourth arrested teenager has been released , with no further action to be taken .
the mother of the injured boy says she has been overwhelmed by support following the attack .
a warwickshire police spokesperson said : `` following the incident , the victim made his way from the park to the canal bridge on donnithorne avenue to seek help .
there are a lot of houses in this area and given the time of day i 'm sure more people will have seen the victim . ''

documents.title: hedgehog census under way
text: a hedgehog census has been launched by a south shropshire-based charity .

the british hedgehog preservation society , based near ludlow , is one of the partners working on the project to find out more about how and where the animals are living , to help stop a sharp decline in numbers .
the research is being done in partnership with the university of reading and warwickshire wildlife trust .
author: Alex Seftel
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: further cuts to leamington police station opening hours
text: further cuts are being made to opening hours at leamington police station .
author: Leamington Observer

documents.title: latin and greek to be taught at coventry school
text: more than £ 6,000 has been given to an academy school in coventry in a bid to get latin lessons back in the classroom .
coventry 's sidney stringer academy will teach latin and greek at gcse level .
the charity classics for all is aiming to get the language and classical history taught in state schools and academies .
author: Alec Blackman
BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: father and daughter triathlon duo
text: a father and daughter from warwickshire are hoping their triathlon adventures will inspire other children with disabilities to take up sport .
chloe , who 's 11 , has cerebral palsy and is visually impaired .
she and her father stephan are taking on the super hero triathlon this weekend .
they will swim almost a mile , cycle 20 miles and finish with a five-mile run .
author: BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: sports headlines : non-league results
text: sports headlines : non-league results
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire Sport

documents.title: watch : today 's weather in 55 seconds
text: it 's started dry in parts of the region , but it looks like there may be rain coming - here 's today 's forecast .
you can also keep up-to-date at any time by heading to the bbc weather website and getting the latest forecast for your area .
author: Rich Davis
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: our coverage across the day
text: we 'll be back with our usual mix of news , sport , travel and weather from 08:00 on wednesday .
keep an eye out here for more updates and breaking news before then .

documents.title: day-night test atmosphere will be fantastic says warwickshire 's woakes
text: chris woakes says the atmosphere at the day-night england test on thursday will be fantastic .
warwickshire 's 28-year-old is in the england squad and looking to start against the west indies at home ground edgbaston .
he said : `` whenever you play at edgbaston it 's always brilliant .
`` the hollies stand is always on fire .
the atmosphere will be fantastic and it will be exciting for the players to be involved with that . ''

documents.title: rugby : wasps ' anglo-welsh cup opposition
text: wasps will face newcastle falcons , ospreys , london irish and leicester tigers in their pool of the anglo-welsh cup .
their first game will be against newcastle at the ricoh arena on saturday , 4 november - kick off 15:00 .
wasps ' other games are :

documents.title: weather : another fine day forecast for tomorrow
text: if you enjoyed the sunny weather today then we 're forecast more of the same tomorrow , with temperatures reaching around 21c ( 70f ) again .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: coventry school wins glowing review at edinburgh fringe
text: a coventry school has earned a glowing four-star review for the production it has taken to the edinburgh fringe festival .
author: Coventry Telegraph

documents.title: cricket : woakes hopes he 's 'done enough ' to be in england side
text: chris woakes says he hopes he has `` done enough '' to get back into the england side as the day-night test at edgbaston looms .
the first test to be played in england under the conditions gets under way on thursday , with west indies the visitors at woakes ' home ground .
the 28-year-old says he is fit to play after suffering a side strain in june .
`` when you 're injured there 's always someone knocking on the door ready to take your place .
`` when you get injured that 's frustrating for you and you have to prove yourself again .
`` i hope i have done enough to show that i 'm ready , and fingers crossed i do play . ''

documents.title: dad writes book for son 's recovery
text: dad writes book for son 's recovery

documents.title: to buy or not to buy togs from dr who 's towering hamlet ?
text: more detail has emerged on the royal shakespeare company 's sale of 10,000 costume items used in productions from the past 20 years .
among them are 12 uniform coats from its 2008 hamlet , which had david tennant in the title role .
if you are looking to add a theatrical look to your wardrobe , you will , at next month 's sale , also be able to buy armour , jewellery , uniforms and doublets - but no singlets .
in the meantime , here 's an apt line from will
costly thy habit as thy purse can buy : but not express 'd in fancy ; rich , not gaudy ; for the apparel oft proclaims the man . ''

documents.title: cricket : bears ' woakes 'fit to play ' in day-night test
text: bears bowler chris woakes says he is fit to play for england in this week 's day-night test match against the west indies at home ground edgbaston .

he has n't played for his country since suffering a side strain during the champions trophy at the beginning of june , but the 28-year-old returned for warwickshire in the county championship last week .
the likelihood of woakes ' inclusion in the starting lineup is assessed here .

documents.title: 'dogflap ' nuneaton burglar caught after leaving his own paw-print behind
text: a burglar who reached through a 'dog flap ' to undo the bolts on the back door of a nuneaton house was caught after leaving his own paw-print behind .
author: Nuneaton News

documents.title: new 50-year lease for coventry theatre
text: a 50-year lease has been signed to keep coventry 's albany theatre at its home on butts road .
the city council will act as guarantor for the first 25 years .
the theatre will also take on an extra 1,000 square metres of space , which will be used for a programme promoting well-being through the arts .

on bbc coventry and warwickshire 's facebook page , it 's a topic that has got you talking .
rough sleeping and begging are real problems now in the city , for the people involved - and for people shopping in the centre .
it is something the council needs to get a handle on and actively help with . ''
perhaps they could use one of the student buildings for the homeless ''

i walked through the town centre precinct yesterday in coventry and saw four guys in different shop doorways laying on double duvets with a double duvet on top begging , surely the council must address this , as it ca n't do anything for local businesses . ''
this is the latest approach in # coventry to deal with # homelessness - is it the right way ?

documents.title: day-night test means 'learning on the job '
text: edgbaston , home of the bears , hosts the first ever day-night test match to be played in england on thursday - only the fifth in international cricket anywhere .
the venue welcomes the west indies and england bowler stuart broad says he is `` excited '' by the format .
`` i watched the day-night match in adelaide and enjoyed it .
the exciting thing as a player is we are going in with a clear mind and learning on the job almost .
`` the team which will come out successful this week will be the team which reacts quicker .
it 's stepping into the unknown completely . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: empty shops boarded up to prevent rough sleepers
text: entrances to empty shops in coventry city centre are being boarded up to stop homeless people sleeping in them .
the business improvement district has told bbc coventry and warwickshire they hope it will encourage rough sleepers to seek refuge in safer areas .
but homeless people in coventry say they feel like they are being pushed out .
this is the latest approach in # coventry to deal with # homelessness - is it the right way ?

text: history-making cricketers ' pink balls

documents.title: gardens 'ruined ' by mysterious flooding
text: a coventry family say their garden is been ruined by mysterious flooding .
they say no-one knows what 's causing the problems in farcroft avenue in eastern green and they ca n't use their gardens until the problem 's solved .
the environment agency says it is working with the city council to investigate how to protect residents from flooding .
author: Richard Williams
BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: district council referred to ombudsman 15 times in last year
text: the local government ombudsman received 15 complaints about stratford district council in the past year .
author: Stratford Observer

documents.title: cricket history to be made at home of the bears
text: the day-night test between england and west indies on thursday is a `` step into the unknown , '' says bowler stuart broad .
edgbaston will host the first ever test to be played under these conditions in england , and the fifth in international cricket anywhere .
i just do n't know what to expect .
we are just going to have to be so adaptable on the day and figure out what 's going on . ''
play will start at 14:00 and continue until 21:00 , with an additional 30 minutes possible at the end of each day 's play .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: police officer pens book for son 's cancer treatment
text: a warwickshire police officer has written a book to help pay for bone cancer treatment for his son .
alex goodwin , who is 10 , has a rare form of the illness called ewing 's sarcoma and is being treated in kansas .
proceeds from dad jeff 's book , alexander 's journey , will go towards paying for alex 's rehab .
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: coventry city : fight for goalkeeper position
text: the sky blues goalkeeper lee burge says he 's determined to stay with the club and fight for his first team place .
burge returned to action after recovering from a shoulder injury by playing in the under-23s 1-0 win against bolton .
summer signing liam o'brien has been in goal for the opening first team games of the season and burge says the competition between the pair will be healthy .
we 're both just going to be fighting it out and he 's doing well at the minute . ''
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire Sport

documents.title: fire fighters sent to hay bale fire in cawston
text: fire fighters were sent to the scene of a hay bale fire in rugby yesterday evening .
author: Rugby Advertiser

documents.title: moeen ali will 'only get better '
text: former england cricket captain michael vaughan says spinner moeen ali is only going to get better .
the former warwickshire star took 25 wickets during the series win against south africa .
speaking to bbc sport he says the all-rounder - in england 's squad for the nation 's first day-night test at edgbaston on thursday - is one of the side 's most valuable performers .
moeen 's bowling throughout this series and for a while now it 's been getting better and better .
if he can keep improving , what we saw from moeen in this series is he is getting better . ''

text: non-league football action
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire Sport

documents.title: teen who ca n't drive stole parents ' car and plunged into ditch
text: a 19-year-old man who took his parents ' car without permission ended up plunging into a ditch .
author: Coventry Telegraph

documents.title: wasps player named england u18 captain
text: wasps academy player tom willis has been named as the captain for the england under 18s side .
the u18s are in south africa on a development tour and play wales tomorrow .
great to see @ twitterid named as captain for @ twitterid u18s second game of the summer tour against wales

documents.title: police record more than 100 crimes involving drones in three months
text: in the three months from 1 april to 30 june the police recorded more than 100 crimes involving drones over shropshire , herefordshire , worcestershire and warwickshire .
the majority involved drones flying over properties , but there were also two reports of drones being shot at , seven of drones flying over prisons and one of a drone flying over a police station .
warwickshire police recorded 30 incidents in that period and west mercia police 80 .
and there were reports of drones crashing into gardens and sports fields and one of an owner trespassing to recover their drone .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: fake cigarettes seized from shops in nuneaton
text: more illegal cigarettes have been taken off the streets of nuneaton following a series of raids .
author: Nuneaton News

documents.title: police seek man over burglaries
text: police in warwickshire want to trace a 22-year-old man from rugby in connection with a number of burglaries there .
police say aiden henry is thought to be in the coventry area and is known to have links to nuneaton .

documents.title: your beautiful skies
text: here 's two gorgeous photos sent in by the bbc weather watchers .
paulamaria took this one in hillmorton .
maidmarion sent in this one of a moody grey sky taken in bidford-on-avon .
send us in your here .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: land rovers and tools targeted by thieves
text: warwickshire-based national farmers union says the cost of rural crime 's gone up in the first six months of the year .
its research suggests the sum has risen by 20 % , with tools , land rovers and livestock targeted by thieves .
author: BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: drug dealer jailed after becoming stranded and arousing sus of residents
text: a drug dealer who aroused the sus of locals after getting stranded in a village near warwick when he was ordered off a train for having no ticket has been jailed .
author: Warwick Courier

documents.title: 'threat to kill ' arrests over woman 's assault
text: two people have been arrested on sus of assault and making threats to kill after a woman was knocked to the ground and left with facial injuries .
she was sat on a bench at bedworth reservoir when , from the other side of the water , police said , a woman verbally abused her , then approached and assaulted her .
the victim , in her 20s , was assaulted again when she tried to run away during the ordeal last thursday afternoon .
the arrested pair - women aged 42 and 20 - have been bailed .
warwickshire police is appealing for witnesses .

documents.title: drainage work plans down the sink after map snag
text: work to improve drainage and make safer a coventry junction has been prolonged because of an incorrect map , according to a city councillor .
broad lane will now be shut for the next three weeks between banner lane and hockley lane while severn trent carries out pipe work .
jayne innes , the cabinet member for city services , told us an incorrect map of the existing pipework is behind the problem .
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: bowls : leamington getting rub of the green
text: bowls england 's national championships is taking place in leamington spa .
bowlers from all over the country are taking part at the event in victoria park .
author: John Bray
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: volunteer-run museum celebrates 50th anniversary
text: a special exhibition is being held as coventry 's midlands air museum celebrates turning 50 years old .
the museum is looking back at the work of its volunteers down the years .
there will be events , workshops , exhibition and guest speakers .

documents.title: police force 'saves thousands ' with electric cars
text: west midlands police says it has saved thousands of pounds by using electric cars .
the force has 33 electric vehicles which officers use for appointments rather than 999 emergencies .
the switch , the force says , has saved it about £ 55,000 .

documents.title: bears keep t20 quarter-final hopes alive
text: warwickshire 's cricketers have kept alive their hopes of qualifying for the quarter-finals of the t20 blast after an eight-wicket victory over durham jets at chester-le-street .
ed pollock and dominic sibley scored half centuries as the bears reached their target with more than five overs to spare .
the bears will battle lancashire lightning on friday at old trafford .
icymi report of yesterday 's 8-wkt victory over durham jets at emirates riverside # youbears
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: your meteor shower
text: you may have seen over the weekend the uk was treated to a meteor shower .
the perseid event occurs every july and august as the earth passes debris from the swift-tuttle comet .
weather watcher kingfisher whisperer snapped this in coventry .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: surge in residents submitting crime information
text: a surge in anonymous crime information in warwickshire has been marked by the crimestoppers charity .
author: Leamington Observer

documents.title: campaigners take to streets over children centre cuts
text: unions say they 'll take their campaign to save jobs at coventry 's children 's centres to the streets .
gmb says its fighting closures to 14 centres amid council budget cuts threatening 100 jobs .
andy groves from the union says members will be in broadgate , coventry , telling the public what the authority 's plans entail .
the city council says its proposals are designed to improve service provision .
author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire

documents.title: 'fantastic win ' for coventry city
text: `` a fantastic result '' - that 's how the sky blues manager mark robins described saturday 's 2-0 victory away to grimsby .
it means coventry sit a couple of points clear at the top of league two .
while robins is n't getting carried away so early into the campaign , he said he could n't fault any of his players at blundell park .
that top of the league feeling
not again coventry city win top of league
wonderful memories of @ twitterid and doyle at @ twitterid they 'll do you proud this season .
x x
the place we need to make home for the rest of the season
what we were saying ( luton ) last week
well done boys
well played @ twitterid congrats on your goal
onto the next one lads .

author: BBC Coventry & Warwickshire Sport
